channel.title: Errors on Git Workflow
channel.description: Recent content in Errors on Git Workflow

item.title: Rolling Back
item.description: Reverting If ever you need to go back to a previous commit, the recommended way is using the revert keyword with the commit id that you would like to revert to: git revert [commit-id] This will firstly revert your current branch to that particular commit but will not lose the history between. It will create a new commit for the reversion which is a safe way to undo code.
